formattedAddress: 205 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 205 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Popular shows in a 1,505-seat Broadway theater with a restored 18th-century-style interior.

originalText.text: If you are a fan of theatre this one is not to be missed. The allure of its historical prowess are a big draw but only a close second to the many amazing plays that go on here. We came for Sweeney Todd and left thoroughly impressed. It's a gorgeous theatre with nice seats.

text.text: If you are a fan of theatre this one is not to be missed. The allure of its historical prowess are a big draw but only a close second to the many amazing plays that go on here. We came for Sweeney Todd and left thoroughly impressed. It's a gorgeous theatre with nice seats.

originalText.text: Named in honor of America's foremost husband-wife acting couple, Alfred Lunt and Lynn Fontanne, my partner and I arrived at the Lunt Fontanne Theatre last night to see Sweeney Todd during Broadway week. We were here back in 2018 for the performance of Summer: The Donna Summer Musical. About 45 minutes prior to the start of the show, the doors were opened, and the staff were outside directing patrons into entry lines, depending on the location of their seats. The staff will seat those on the mezzanine level first. However, due to the bitter cold winds, once those in the mezzanine went inside, the staff would then let those in the orchestra level inside to the mezzanine level to use the bathroom, stop at the bar or buy souvenirs, and wait until the inside theater doors were opened. Once inside, we were greeted by the staff, who scanned both of our tickets and then directed us to our seats. Several ushers inside were making sure that everyone got to their seats without issue. Since the stage is so high in the first 4 rows, these will have some view obstructions. It’s suggested to get seats beyond that, as we were in orchestra row K. The acoustics were perfect, especially to hear the live music from a classic 26-player orchestration and be able to see the stage without any obstructions. However, some seats were tight if you're tall and don’t leave room for each other. The performance was incredibly lively, and the atmosphere had just the right touch of spooky elements, adding to the overall charm of the show, which we can recommend.

originalText.text:
Gorgeous theater.
The seats were not bad, if you are not very tall, there is just adequate leg space.
There is a neat restroom and a small bar.
You can also purchase merch.
The sound in the theater is exceptionally good. Even though we were in the rare mezzanine, we could hear the songs perfectly well and enjoyed the show a lot.
A good theater and an outstanding show.

originalText.text: Absolutely beautiful theater.  The line outside was very long but went fast. The drinks were expensive but the staff was working hard and fast to accommodate everyone. The show was a few minutes delayed to accommodate for all the people in line which was nice, they told us in line for drinks how much longer we had. The bathrooms were well organized,  there was someone directing traffic during intermission because the lines to the bathroom were so long. But again lovely theater,  would absolutely recommend and come to again.

But again lovely theater,  would absolutely recommend and come to again.

originalText.text: What a beautiful theater !   Visited 11/10 to see Sweeney Todd. Was slightly taken aback though when we walked in and was in the auditorium ! No lobby!   Judging by the long line to get I thought we surely would be running late, but once the doors opened, we were inside quickly and seated - show started a couple minutes after 7.  I even had time to run back to the bar and grab a cocktail-  Seats were comfy, acoustics great.   Perfect place for a show !
